Dispute_Type: Rent and fee disagreement under sublease agreement
Legal_Issue: Whether the fair market rent set by CPV in 2000 was appropriate and whether RV storage must be provided free of charge
Governing_Law: Terms of the sublease agreement defining 'fair market rent' as basic rent, not gross rent
Evidence_Assessment: Expert testimonies on fair market rent, analysis of lease agreements, billing practices, and appraisal evidence
Decision_Outcome: CPV's 2000 rent increase was unjustified; RV storage must be provided free of charge to eligible tenants
Burden_of_Proof: Plaintiffs demonstrated that 1996 rent reflected fair market value
Credibility_Factor: Court relied on expert testimony and comparative rental data
Legal_Rule: Fair market rent is determined by direct comparison approach, excluding lease conditions unless explicitly included
Standard_of_Review: Objective interpretation of contract terms and market evidence
Procedural_Issue: Interpretation and application of lease provisions regarding rent calculation
Grounds_for_Claim: Unjustified rent increase and improper RV storage fees
Review_Standard: De novo review of legal interpretation, deference to factual findings based on evidence
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Full trial with presentation of evidence and expert testimony
Key_Evidence_Considered: Lease text, 1996 and 2000 rent data, expert appraisals, billing records
Legal_Framework: Contract law, interpretation of sublease terms, fair market value principles
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged validity of rent increase and RV storage charges
Court_Result: Ruled for plaintiffs; declared rent increase inappropriate and mandated free RV storage
Legal_Rule_Source: Sublease agreement and common law contract interpretation
Defendant_Response: CPV claimed higher rent reflected current fair market value
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence (leases, bills), expert testimony, market comparisons
Remedy_Requested: Declaration of proper rent amount and injunction against improper RV fees
Outcome: Court granted declaratory relief and required compliance with original fair market rent and free RV storage
Decision_Authority: Trial court with jurisdiction over contract disputes
Remedy_Sought: Restitution of overpaid rent and enforcement of contractual rights
Authority: Contractual agreement between parties and judicial interpretation
Legal_Provision_Cited: Definition of 'fair market rent' in sublease agreement
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Allegation of breach of contract terms
Applicable_Process: Civil litigation process including discovery, trial, and evidentiary hearing
Pending_Relief_or_Application: None indicated – matter resolved at trial level
Jurisdiction: State trial court with civil jurisdiction over property and contract matters
Governing_Rule: Interpretation of contract terms based on plain language and market evidence
